basic_info.name: Kia Carnival
basic_info.description: Kia Carnival is a 7-seater  available at a starting price of Rs. 59.42 Lakh. The car is available in 1 variants, with 1 engine and 1 transmission option. Additionally, Carnival offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 180 mm and a Boot capacity of 540 liters. You can choose from 2 colors for the Carnival. The mileage of the Carnival varies from 13.9 KM/L depending on the model.

pros: Captain Seats In Limousine Variant Is A Must Buy

Introduction: The Kia Carnival is a premium family MPV designed to offer spacious and comfortable seating.
This makes it an ideal vehicle for large families or business use.
Comfort is the unique selling point of the Carnival as it offers VIP lounge second-row seats with adjustments and more.
It also boasts advanced tech features like big digital displays for the driver and infotainment, ADAS, and a Bose audio system.
All in all, the Carnival focuses on a comfortable and stable ride than outright performance.
Exterior: The Carnival’s tall plus wide face with a big patterned grille and sharp lights give it a confident look amongst boxy MPVs.
Then, the slim LED headlights offer bright visibility during night drives.
From the side, it looks long and stretched out, with large doors and big windows.
Its size in itself makes it clear that it is built to carry several people comfortably.
Then, pillars around the windows are partly blacked out, so the roof seems to float above the glass.
The rear looks neat and upright, with a wide tailgate that opens to reveal a big boot.
Slim LED tail lamps run across the back, giving it a clean and modern look.It has large alloy wheels that fill the wheel arches, complementing the premium design.
Furthermore, the side doors are sliding doors, powered to open and close at the touch of a button.
At the back, the boot door is also powered, so it can lift itself automatically.
Moreover, the luxury MPV also gets roof rails, a sleek little shark fin antenna, and a dual sunroof in other variants.
Interior: Step inside the Carnival, and you’ll notice the dashboard has large 12.3-inch digital screens side-by-side, like twin computer monitors.
These displays show maps, speed, and entertainment for the driver and passenger.
Driver and front passenger seats adjust eight-way electrically, with heating and cooling fans.
Its centre console has a wide middle storage area between front seats holds phones, cups, and small items.
Furthermore, this console also features wireless charging pads, USB plugs, and armrests for resting your elbow.
The second-row seats recline with footrests that pop up, plus heating, ventilation, and 14-way power adjustments.
Ample legroom and headroom fit adults comfortably in all rows, with rear air conditioning vents and controls for each zone.
There are foldable seats as well that expand cargo area for additional space for bags or gear.
While the 64-colour ambient lighting adds some colour, the dual sunroofs above front and rear rows open for fresh air and an open view.
Powertrain: The Carnival is powered by a 2.2-litre diesel engine producing 202.77bhp and 441Nm of torque.
This mill comes mated to an eight-speed automatic transmission and offers a front wheel drive system.
Furthermore, the Carnival offers a claimed mileage of 14.85kmpl.
